# ğŸ–¼ï¸ Image Captioning Web App

An interactive **image captioning web application** built with **Streamlit** and powered by the **BLIP (Bootstrapping Language-Image Pre-training)** visionâ€“language model.  
The app generates natural language descriptions for user-uploaded images and allows real-time experimentation with text generation parameters.

---

## ğŸš€ Live Application

The application is publicly available and deployed on **Streamlit Community Cloud**:

ğŸ”— **https://150220305yzv211hw3.streamlit.app**

---

## ğŸ§  Project Overview

This project explores the intersection of **computer vision** and **natural language processing** by leveraging a pre-trained multimodal transformer model.  
Users can upload an image and instantly receive one or more descriptive captions generated by the model.

Beyond basic captioning, the application allows users to:
- Control randomness and creativity
- Adjust output length
- Generate multiple caption variants
- Guide the caption generation with an optional text prompt

The goal is to provide a simple yet powerful playground for experimenting with visionâ€“language models.

---

## âœ¨ Features

- **Image Upload**
  - Supports `JPG`, `JPEG`, and `PNG` formats
- **BLIP Image Captioning Model**
  - Uses `Salesforce/blip-image-captioning-base` via Hugging Face Transformers
- **Customizable Generation Parameters**
  - **Temperature:** Controls randomness vs. determinism
  - **Minimum Length:** Sets a lower bound on caption length
  - **Maximum Length:** Prevents overly long outputs
  - **Number of Variations:** Generate multiple captions for the same image
- **Conditional Captioning**
  - Optional prompt input to guide or start the generated caption
- **Interactive UI**
  - Real-time updates using Streamlit

---

- **Python**
- **Streamlit** â€“ Web interface
- **Hugging Face Transformers**

# ğŸ“¦ Installation & Local Setup

Follow these steps to run the project locally:

## 1. Clone the Repository
```bash
git clone https://github.com/erdemhasbek/150220305yzv211hw3.git
cd 150220305yzv211hw3
```

## 2. Install Tools
```bash
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

## 3. Start the App
```bash
streamlit run app.py
```
